projectDesc.p: To the tune “Cross the Stream and Reset, Close”—"Sobered up" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the tune “Cross the Stream and Reset, Close”—"Sobered up"
I have just awoken from a dream,
The fragrant charcoal in the little chamber has burnt into ashes.
Upon the door, the silver toad moves its shadow.

l.app: 人寂靜。 <rdg wit="#Translation"Everyone is still and quiet.

app.rdg: The night has no end, pure and cold.
On the green tiles, frost congeals;
Wind swings through the loose bamboo curtain.
The sound of the dripping clock is dim,
Drifting to me and dismaying this listener.
What can I do with my heart,
Which has been listless recently, as if sick for a long time?
The phoenix tower is only a step away,
Yet the date to reunite is far from settled.
Tossing and turning, I cannot sleep.
The shiny pillow is ice cold;
The smoke from the coiling incense stops.
Who will tidy up my double quilt?
